T.A Paris BnF fr. 23112 - Transcription: De se biaute de se figure
T.A Edited: De se biaute de se figure
T.A Translation: Of her beauty, of her figure

T.A Paris BnF fr. 23112 - Transcription: Si co ele est en escriture
T.A Edited: Si com ele est en escriture
T.A Translation: as it is in the written source
I want to say a little about her appearance
before I go too far.

T.A Paris BnF fr. 23112 - Transcription: Car a cel tans en icel regne
T.A Edited: Car a cel tans en icel regne
T.A Translation: For at that time in that reign,

T.A Paris BnF fr. 23112 - Transcription: Ne vit nus hom plus bele feme
T.A Edited: Ne vit nus hom plus bele feme
T.A Translation: no man saw a more beautiful woman.
Never countess nor queen

T.A Paris BnF fr. 23112 - Transcription: Nen ot el front plus bele crine
T.A Edited: Nen ot el front plus bele crine
T.A Translation: had over her brow more beautiful hair.
She had round ears.
What's more, they were marvelously white,
her eyes bright and smiling,
her eyebrows black and becoming,
her little mouth mild,
and pious her gaze,
her face tender and blushing

T.A Paris BnF fr. 23112 - Transcription: Co le rose q sempre est nee
T.A Edited: Com le rose qui sempre est nee
T.A Translation: like the rose that is always in bloom.

T.A Paris BnF fr. 23112 - Transcription: Ja el nes ne el menton
T.A Edited: Ja el nes ne el menton
T.A Translation: Indeed neither on her nose nor on her chin
would you be aware of any defect.

T.A Paris BnF fr. 23112 - Transcription: En som le col blanc c ermine
T.A Edited: En som le col blanc com ermine
T.A Translation: Her neck was white like ermine too.

T.A Paris BnF fr. 23112 - Transcription: li un doit le bloie crine
T.A Translation: There flowed her blonde hair.
The breasts of this lady
were no smaller than apples.

T.A Paris BnF fr. 23112 - Transcription: Desous le goule en le poitne
T.A Edited: Desous le goule en le poitrine
T.A Translation: Above the cleavage of her chest,
it was white like hawthorn flower.
She had white arms and white hands,
her fingers shapely, slender, and smooth.
She had a fine body and well molded
from her underarm along her rib.

T.A Paris BnF fr. 23112 - Transcription: El niert tp gnt ne tp petite
T.A Edited: El n'iert trop grant no trop petite
T.A Translation: She was neither too big nor too small.

T.A Paris BnF fr. 23112 - Transcription: Ja se faichon ne iert escte
T.A Edited: Ja se faichon n'en iert escrite
T.A Translation: Her frame could never be written.

T.A Paris BnF fr. 23112 - Transcription: Ja le biaute de ceste dame
T.A Edited: Ja le biaute de ceste dame
T.A Translation: The beauty of this lady

T.A Paris BnF fr. 23112 - Transcription: Nen iert escte p nul home
T.A Edited: Nen iert escrite par nul home
T.A Translation: could never be written by any man.
She was so courteous of speech.
There was nothing to improve.
Such a creature makes one lament
when she does not care about the Creator.
She received many presents
and bought herself good garments.
She had good and fitting clothes

T.A Paris BnF fr. 23112 - Transcription: Por mix plaisir a ses amans
T.A Edited: Por mix plaisir a ses amans
T.A Translation: to better please her lovers.

T.A Paris BnF fr. 23112 - Transcription: Ele navoit soig de dras de laine
T.A Edited: Ele n'avoit soing de dras de lainne
T.A Translation: She did not care for woollen cloth.

T.A Paris BnF fr. 23112 - Transcription: Au pior jor de le semaine
T.A Edited: Au pior jor de le semainne
T.A Translation: On the worst day of the week,
she had a fine purple silk bliaut
and adorned herself with an ermine mantle.
Well-painted shoes of Cordovan leather

T.A Paris BnF fr. 23112 - Transcription: Cauchoit a tous les jors del an
T.A Edited: Cauchoit a tous les jors de l'an
T.A Translation: she put these on all the days of the year.
The citizens of the city
loved her entirely for her beauty.
The old men and the wise
would all say, "God, what a shame!

T.A Paris BnF fr. 23112 - Transcription: Com mar fu onc ceste dolante
T.A Edited: Com mar fu onc ceste dolante
T.A Translation: Oh alas evermore for this suffering!

T.A Paris BnF fr. 23112 - Transcription: Tant fait a plaindre se iovete
T.A Edited: Tant fait a plaindre se jovente
T.A Translation: There is much to bemoan of her youth.

T.A Paris BnF fr. 23112 - Transcription: Tant mar fu onqs le siue vie
T.A Edited: Tant mar fu onques le siue vie
T.A Translation: Alas evermore for her life

T.A Paris BnF fr. 23112 - Transcription: Qnt si est plainne de folie
T.A Edited: Quant si est plainne de folie
T.A Translation: as it is so full of folly."
Everyone in the city would say
that she was of high parentage
for she answered all with reason
and had such a beautiful frame
that the son of an emperor

T.A Paris BnF fr. 23112 - Transcription: Le peust prendre a gnt honor
T.A Edited: Le peust prendre a grant honor
T.A Translation: could have taken her with great honor.

T.A Paris BnF fr. 23112 - Transcription: Tant ala p jor & p nuit
T.A Edited: Tant ala par jor & par nuit
T.A Translation: So she went by day and by night

T.A Paris BnF fr. 23112 - Transcription: A faim & a soif & a dur lit
T.A Edited: A faim & a soif & a dur lit
T.A Translation: hungry, thirsty, and on hard beds.

T.A Paris BnF fr. 23112 - Transcription: Que tant pfont fu el boscaige
T.A Edited: Que tant parfont fu el boscaige
T.A Translation: She was so deep in the wood
that she became entirely wild there,
but she never forgot
to pray to saint May.

T.A Paris BnF fr. 23112 - Transcription: Sovent li menbroit del y maige
T.A Translation: Often she remembered the image

T.A Paris BnF fr. 23112 - Transcription: Que ele avoit mis en ostaige
T.A Edited: Que ele avoit mis en ostaige
T.A Translation: on which she had made her pledge.
Soon her shoes were worn out,
and soon her clothes were all torn up.

T.A Paris BnF fr. 23112 - Transcription: Li cors de li remaint tout nu
T.A Edited: Li cors de li remaint tout nu
T.A Translation: Her body was left totally naked.
She did not have clothing that was not in tatters.

T.A Edited: Li chars de li mua coulor
T.A Translation: Her own flesh changed color,

T.A Paris BnF fr. 23112 - Transcription: Qui ains iert blance ome flor
T.A Edited: Qui ains iert blance conme flor
T.A Translation: that which before was white like a flower.

T.A Paris BnF fr. 23112 - Transcription: Que por yver q por este
T.A Edited: Que por yver que por este
T.A Translation: From winter as from summer,
her sides blackened entirely.
The color of her blonde hair changed.
It turned white like an ermine.
Her mouth was thinned,
and all around it blackened,
and her chin was so black

T.A Paris BnF fr. 23112 - Transcription: Come sil fust taint de carbon
T.A Edited: Conme s'il fust taint de carbon
T.A Translation: as though it were dyed with charcoal.
Thinned were her eyes.
There was not a shred of pride now.
If you saw her ears,

T.A Paris BnF fr. 23112 - Transcription: Mlt p v presist gns mveilles
T.A Edited: Molt par vos presist grans merveilles
T.A Translation: you would really take in a great marvel.
for they were black and cracked.
Her white flesh changed entirely
Black and changed was her chest.
It seemed like thorny bark.

T.A Paris BnF fr. 23112 - Transcription: Navoit plus char en ses tians
T.A Edited: N'avoit plus char en ses traians
T.A Translation: There was no more flesh in her breasts,

T.A Paris BnF fr. 23112 - Transcription: Ne mais o il a en uns gans
T.A Edited: Ne mais com il a en uns gans
T.A Translation: no more than there is in a glove.

T.A Paris BnF fr. 23112 - Transcription: Les bras les mais & leslos dois
T.A Edited: Les bras les mains & les lons dois
T.A Translation: Her arms, her hands, and her long fingers

T.A Paris BnF fr. 23112 - Transcription: Avoit plus noirs q nule pois
T.A Edited: Avoit plus noirs que nule pois
T.A Translation: were blacker than any pitch.
She had long and large nails.

T.A Paris BnF fr. 23112 - Transcription: Ele les retailloit a ses dens
T.A Edited: Ele les retailloit a ses dens
T.A Translation: She reshaped them with her teeth.
Her stomach was sunken.
She put little provisions in there.
Her feet were split.
In many places, they were wounded

T.A Paris BnF fr. 23112 - Transcription: Car ele ne se gardoit despine
T.A Edited: Car ele ne se gardoit d'espine
T.A Translation: for she did not protect herself from thorns

T.A Paris BnF fr. 23112 - Transcription: Qnt ele aloit p le gastine
T.A Edited: Quant ele aloit par le gastine
T.A Translation: as she went through the wilderness.

T.A Paris BnF fr. 23112 - Transcription: Che li ert vis sien esciant
T.A Edited: Che li ert vis sien esciant
T.A Translation: It seemed to her, in her mind,
she was not wrong about this at all,

T.A Paris BnF fr. 23112 - Transcription: Cuns de ses pekies li caoit
T.A Edited: C'uns de ses pekies li caoit
T.A Translation: that one of her sins fell away
when a thorn pricked her.

T.A Edited: Por chou estoit ele molt lie
T.A Translation: For this, she was so pleased
as she suffered hardship.
It was no marvel that she was blackened
for she led such a severe life.

T.A Paris BnF fr. 23112 - Transcription: Plus de xl. ans ala nue
T.A Edited: Plus de xl. ans ala nue
T.A Translation: After more than forty years in the nude,
it was no marvel she was wooly.
She had poor provisions with her.

T.A Paris BnF fr. 23112 - Transcription: Or ait jhc de li merchi
T.A Edited: Or ait Jhesus de li merchi
T.A Translation: Pray, may Jesus have mercy on her.
She had two breads of no great size.

T.A Paris BnF fr. 23112 - Transcription: De chiaus vesq p plusors ans
T.A Edited: De chiaus vesqui par plusors ans
T.A Translation: On these, she lived for many years.
In the first year, they became hard

T.A Paris BnF fr. 23112 - Transcription: Co se fust pierre de mur
T.A Edited: Com se fust pierre de mur
T.A Translation: as though they were building stones.
Each day, Mary ate some,
but this was a small portion.

T.A Paris BnF fr. 23112 - Transcription: Qnt ele ot tot son pain use
T.A Edited: Quant ele ot tot son pain use
T.A Translation: As soon as she had eaten up all her bread,
then she plucked the grass nearby.
Like other beasts she ate it.
She provided herself with nothing else.

T.A Paris BnF fr. 23112 - Transcription: As mains buvoit liaue el ruissel
T.A Edited: As mains buvoit l'iaue el ruissel
T.A Translation: On her hands, she drank the water from the stream
as she had no other vessel.

T.A Paris BnF fr. 23112 - Transcription: Ne font a plaindre li pechie
T.A Edited: Ne font a plaindre li pechie
T.A Translation: She does not bemoan her sins

T.A Paris BnF fr. 23112 - Transcription: Dont li cors fu si castie
T.A Edited: Dont li cors fu si castie
T.A Translation: as her body is so chastised.
On grass she lived and on roots
for seventeen years in the wilderness.

T.A Paris BnF fr. 23112 - Transcription: Puis fu .xxx. ans onc ne menga
T.A Edited: Puis fu .xxx. ans onc ne menga
T.A Translation: Then for thirty years, she never ate
but what the angel brought to her.
In the first year, the devil
often used to tempt her,
making her remember all
that she used to always love.

T.A Paris BnF fr. 23112 - Transcription: Les bons mgiers & les biax lieus
T.A Edited: Les bons mengiers & les biax lieus
T.A Translation: The good eats and the beautiful places

T.A Paris BnF fr. 23112 - Transcription: Ou ele soloit faire les geus
T.A Edited: Ou ele soloit faire les geus
T.A Translation: where she was used to playing games.
Now, she was so blissful
that she had forgotten all.

T.A Paris BnF fr. 23112 - Transcription: Onqs puis en toute se vie
T.A Edited: Onques puis en toute se vie
T.A Translation: Never then in all her life

T.A Paris BnF fr. 23112 - Transcription: Ne li souvint mais de folie
T.A Edited: Ne li souvint mais de folie
T.A Translation: did she think more of folly.

T.A Paris BnF fr. 23112 - Transcription: Ne ainc en trestot le boscaige
T.A Edited: Ne ainc en trestot le boscaige
T.A Translation: Never in all the wood

T.A Paris BnF fr. 23112 - Transcription: Ne li vint puis beste salvaige
T.A Edited: Ne li vint puis beste salvaige
T.A Translation: did any wild beast come to her then
nor any other living creature.

T.A Paris BnF fr. 23112 - Transcription: P le gaut va toute seure
T.A Edited: Par le gaut va toute seure
T.A Translation: Through the glen, she goes totally sure.

T.A Paris BnF fr. 23112 - Transcription: En plusors lius prist son ostel
T.A Edited: En plusors lius prist son ostel
T.A Translation: In many places, she took shelter.
Her life was entirely spiritual.
